text: a great way to use up the fall bounty of
apples from the farmers market is to
bake them it couldn't be easier it makes
a delicious simple dessert and a really
healthy breakfast so I have for Rome
apples you want to go with thick-skinned
medium apples about like this and I'm
going to core them from the top try not
to go all the way through to the bottom
that'll just help keep the Apple whole
during baking I like to use a melon
baller for this you can also use a
paring knife if you have one of those
cylindrical cores you can use that here
to work your way until you reach the
core and transfer it to a smallish pan
we want these to be pretty snug so that
we have plenty of pan juice for serving
if you don't have an oval pan you can
also use a pie dish anything that fits
the apples snugly for my filling 3
tablespoons of dark brown sugar to this
I'm adding 2 tablespoons of coconut oil
you can use butter if you'd like I
really love the flavor of coconut oil
with pecans 2 tablespoon of chopped
toasted pecans save a little bit for the
top that's what we're gonna garnish with
just mix that in there and then my
favorite part probably my favorite spice
in the pantry vanilla bean I'm gonna use
half of one today so make a small slit
down 1/2 of a vanilla bean and then use
the backside of a sharp knife to scrape
out the seeds the fresh vanilla bean
adds a really really pungent flavor if
you don't have fresh vanilla bean you
can substitute with vanilla extract I
would start with about a quarter of a
teaspoon and taste and see if we need to
add more you can also add other spices
ground cinnamon freshly grated nutmeg
you can really just customize this
however you'd like let's add a pinch of
salt
just to help round out all these flavors
okay make sure is nice and combined so
let's stuff the apples you're shooting
for about two teaspoons per Apple
already smells incredible haven't even
started baking don't worry if some of
the filling spills out into the dish it
will mingle with all the apple juices
while it's baking make a really really
nice pan sauce finishing touch will
sprinkle with a few reserved chopped
pecans adds a really nice crunch nice
nutty flavor heart healthy fats
everything we love here at eat clean
bake these at 375 degrees for about 45
minutes start checking at 30 minutes
depending on the size of your Apple and
the freshness we want to make sure these
are nice and whole and tender and
wonderful you smell delicious beautiful
color another great thing about baked
apples is that you get to enjoy the skin
and the flesh a lot of nutrients in the
skin make sure you serve all these
delicious pan juices along with the
baked apple final touch love the Greek
yogurt nice amount of calcium creaminess
especially if I'm enjoying these for
breakfast yum-yum can't wait to try this
looks gorgeous the Apple is perfectly
tender not mushy it's a big bite I'm
gonna go for it though
mmm
really tasty a little bit sweet a little
bit coconutty totally satisfying dessert
even better breakfast
you
